details:
Several vulnerabilities were discovered in wordpress, a web blogging
tool. The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures project identifies the
following issues.


* [CVE-2017-8295](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-8295)
Potential unauthorized password reset vulnerability. More
 information are available at:


* [CVE-2017-9061](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9061)
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists when someone
 attempts to upload very large files.
* [CVE-2017-9062](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9062)
Improper handling of post meta data values in the XML-RPC API.
* [CVE-2017-9063](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9063)
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the customizer.
* [CVE-2017-9064](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9064)
A Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability exists in the
 filesystem credentials dialog.
* [CVE-2017-9065](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9065)
Lack of capability checks for post meta data in the XML-RPC API.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
3.6.1+dfsg-1~deb7u15.


We recommend that you upgrade your wordpress packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
